1.verse: How doth the city sit solitary, that was full of people!

2.verse: She weepeth sore in the night, and her tears are on her cheeks;

3.verse: Judah is gone into captivity because of affliction, and because of great servitude;

4.verse: The ways of Zion do mourn, because none come to the solemn assembly;

5.verse: Her adversaries are become the head, her enemies prosper;

6.verse: And from the daughter of Zion all her majesty is departed:

7.verse: Jerusalem remembereth in the days of her affliction and of her miseries all her pleasant things that were from the days of old:

8.verse: Jerusalem hath grievously sinned; therefore she is become as an unclean thing;

9.verse: Her filthiness was in her skirts; she remembered not her latter end;

10.verse: The adversary hath spread out his hand upon all her pleasant things:

11.verse: All her people sigh, they seek bread;

12.verse: Is it nothing to you, all ye that pass by?

13.verse: From on high hath he sent fire into my bones, and it prevaileth against them;

14.verse: The yoke of my transgressions is bound by his hand;

15.verse: The Lord hath set at nought all my mighty men in the midst of me;

16.verse: For these things I weep; mine eye, mine eye runneth down with water;

17.verse: Zion spreadeth forth her hands; there is none to comfort her;

18.verse: Jehovah is righteous; for I have rebelled against his commandment:

19.verse: I called for my lovers, but they deceived me:

20.verse: Behold, O Jehovah; for I am in distress; my heart is troubled;

21.verse: They have heard that I sigh; there is none to comfort me;

22.verse: Let all their wickedness come before thee;

1.verse: How hath the Lord covered the daughter of Zion with a cloud in his anger!

2.verse: The Lord hath swallowed up all the habitations of Jacob, and hath not pitied:

3.verse: He hath cut off in fierce anger all the horn of Israel;

4.verse: He hath bent his bow like an enemy, he hath stood with his right hand as an adversary,

5.verse: The Lord is become as an enemy, he hath swallowed up Israel;

6.verse: And he hath violently taken away his tabernacle, as if it were of a garden; he hath destroyed his place of assembly:

7.verse: The Lord hath cast off his altar, he hath abhorred his sanctuary;

8.verse: Jehovah hath purposed to destroy the wall of the daughter of Zion;

9.verse: Her gates are sunk into the ground; he hath destroyed and broken her bars:

10.verse: The elders of the daughter of Zion sit upon the ground, they keep silence;

11.verse: Mine eyes do fail with tears, my heart is troubled;

12.verse: They say to their mothers, Where is grain and wine?

13.verse: What shall I testify unto thee? what shall I liken to thee, O daughter of Jerusalem?

14.verse: Thy prophets have seen for thee false and foolish visions;

15.verse: All that pass by clap their hands at thee;

16.verse: All thine enemies have opened their mouth wide against thee;

17.verse: Jehovah hath done that which he purposed; he hath fulfilled his word that he commanded in the days of old;

18.verse: Their heart cried unto the Lord:

19.verse: Arise, cry out in the night, at the beginning of the watches;

20.verse: See, O Jehovah, and behold to whom thou hast done thus!

21.verse: The youth and the old man lie on the ground in the streets;

22.verse: Thou hast called, as in the day of a solemn assembly, my terrors on every side;

1.verse: I am the man that hath seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.

2.verse: He hath led me and caused me to walk in darkness, and not in light.

3.verse: Surely against me he turneth his hand again and again all the day.

4.verse: My flesh and my skin hath he made old; he hath broken my bones.

5.verse: He hath builded against me, and compassed me with gall and travail.

6.verse: He hath made me to dwell in dark places, as those that have been long dead.

7.verse: He hath walled me about, that I cannot go forth; he hath made my chain heavy.

8.verse: Yea, when I cry, and call for help, he shutteth out my prayer.

9.verse: He hath walled up my ways with hewn stone; he hath made my paths crooked.

10.verse: He is unto me as a bear lying in wait, as a lion in secret places.

11.verse: He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces; he hath made me desolate.

12.verse: He hath bent his bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.

13.verse: He hath caused the shafts of his quiver to enter into my reins.

14.verse: I am become a derision to all my people, and their song all the day.

15.verse: He hath filled me with bitterness, he hath sated me with wormwood.

16.verse: He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones; he hath covered me with ashes.

17.verse: And thou hast removed my soul far off from peace; I forgat prosperity.

18.verse: And I said, My strength is perished, and mine expectation from Jehovah.

19.verse: Remember mine affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.

20.verse: My soul hath them still in remembrance, and is bowed down within me.

21.verse: This I recall to my mind; therefore have I hope.

22.verse: It is of Jehovahâ€™s lovingkindnesses that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.

23.verse: They are new every morning; great is thy faithfulness.

24.verse: Jehovah is my portion, saith my soul; therefore will I hope in him.

25.verse: Jehovah is good unto them that wait for him, to the soul that seeketh him.

26.verse: It is good that a man should hope and quietly wait for the salvation of Jehovah.

27.verse: It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.

28.verse: Let him sit alone and keep silence, because he hath laid it upon him.

29.verse: Let him put his mouth in the dust, if so be there may be hope.

30.verse: Let him give his cheek to him that smiteth him; let him be filled full with reproach.

31.verse: For the Lord will not cast off for ever.

32.verse: For though he cause grief, yet will he have compassion according to the multitude of his lovingkindnesses.

33.verse: For he doth not afflict willingly, nor grieve the children of men.

34.verse: To crush under foot all the prisoners of the earth,

35.verse: To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the Most High,

36.verse: To subvert a man in his cause, the Lord approveth not.

37.verse: Who is he that saith, and it cometh to pass, when the Lord commandeth it not?

38.verse: Out of the mouth of the Most High cometh there not evil and good?

39.verse: Wherefore doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?

40.verse: Let us search and try our ways, and turn again to Jehovah.

41.verse: Let us lift up our heart with our hands unto God in the heavens.

42.verse: We have transgressed and have rebelled; thou hast not pardoned.

43.verse: Thou hast covered with anger and pursued us; thou hast slain, thou hast not pitied.

44.verse: Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud, so that no prayer can pass through.

45.verse: Thou hast made us an offscouring and refuse in the midst of the peoples.

46.verse: All our enemies have opened their mouth wide against us.

47.verse: Fear and the pit are come upon us, devastation and destruction.

48.verse: Mine eye runneth down with streams of water, for the destruction of the daughter of my people.

49.verse: Mine eye poureth down, and ceaseth not, without any intermission,

50.verse: Till Jehovah look down, and behold from heaven.

51.verse: Mine eye affecteth my soul, because of all the daughters of my city.

52.verse: They have chased me sore like a bird, they that are mine enemies without cause.

53.verse: They have cut off my life in the dungeon, and have cast a stone upon me.

54.verse: Waters flowed over my head; I said, I am cut off.

55.verse: I called upon thy name, O Jehovah, out of the lowest dungeon.

56.verse: Thou heardest my voice; hide not thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.

57.verse: Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee; thou saidst, Fear not.

58.verse: O Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; thou hast redeemed my life.

59.verse: O Jehovah, thou hast seen my wrong; judge thou my cause.

60.verse: Thou hast seen all their vengeance and all their devices against me.

61.verse: Thou hast heard their reproach, O Jehovah, and all their devices against me,

62.verse: The lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.

63.verse: Behold thou their sitting down, and their rising up; I am their song.

64.verse: Thou wilt render unto them a recompense, O Jehovah, according to the work of their hands.

65.verse: Thou wilt give them hardness of heart, thy curse unto them.

66.verse: Thou wilt pursue them in anger, and destroy them from under the heavens of Jehovah.

1.verse: How is the gold become dim! how is the most pure gold changed!

2.verse: The precious sons of Zion, comparable to fine gold,

3.verse: Even the jackals draw out the breast, they give suck to their young ones:

4.verse: The tongue of the sucking child cleaveth to the roof of his mouth for thirst:

5.verse: They that did feed delicately are desolate in the streets:

6.verse: For the iniquity of the daughter of my people is greater than the sin of Sodom,

7.verse: Her nobles were purer than snow, they were whiter than milk;

8.verse: Their visage is blacker than a coal; they are not known in the streets:

9.verse: They that are slain with the sword are better than they that are slain with hunger;

10.verse: The hands of the pitiful women have boiled their own children;

11.verse: Jehovah hath accomplished his wrath, he hath poured out his fierce anger;

12.verse: The kings of the earth believed not, neither all the inhabitants of the world,

13.verse: It is because of the sins of her prophets, and the iniquities of her priests,

14.verse: They wander as blind men in the streets, they are polluted with blood,

15.verse: Depart ye, they cried unto them, Unclean! depart, depart, touch not!

16.verse: The anger of Jehovah hath scattered them; he will no more regard them:

17.verse: Our eyes do yet fail in looking for our vain help:

18.verse: They hunt our steps, so that we cannot go in our streets:

19.verse: Our pursuers were swifter than the eagles of the heavens:

20.verse: The breath of our nostrils, the anointed of Jehovah, was taken in their pits;

21.verse: Rejoice and be glad, O daughter of Edom, that dwellest in the land of Uz:

22.verse: The punishment of thine iniquity is accomplished, O daughter of Zion; he will no more carry thee away into captivity:

1.verse: Remember, O Jehovah, what is come upon us:

2.verse: Our inheritance is turned unto strangers,

4.verse: We have drunken our water for money;

5.verse: Our pursuers are upon our necks:

6.verse: We have given the hand to the Egyptians,

7.verse: Our fathers sinned, and are not;

9.verse: We get our bread at the peril of our lives,

10.verse: Our skin is black like an oven,

11.verse: They ravished the women in Zion,

12.verse: Princes were hanged up by their hand:

13.verse: The young men bare the mill;

14.verse: The elders have ceased from the gate,

15.verse: The joy of our heart is ceased;

16.verse: The crown is fallen from our head:

17.verse: For this our heart is faint;

18.verse: For the mountain of Zion, which is desolate:

19.verse: Thou, O Jehovah, abidest for ever;

20.verse: Wherefore dost thou forget us for ever,

21.verse: Turn thou us unto thee, O Jehovah, and we shall be turned;

22.verse: But thou hast utterly rejected us;
